document_data.name: Cult of Voldini
document_data.mainbody: The '''cult of Voldini''' was a group of [[elven]] fanatics dedicated to returning the lost kingdom of [[Yuireshanyaar]] to prominence in the realm of [[Aglarond]],{{Cite organized play/LFR/Through Twilight Boughs|13}} and restoring to existence the ancient gods of the [[Yuir pantheon]].{{Cite organized play/LFR/Through Twilight Boughs|4}} It was believed to have been led by [[Voldini]], an [[noble eladrin|eladrin]] witch who dwelled within a solitary tower on an isle within the realm.{{Cite organized play/LFR/Twilight Ambitions|5}}{{Cite organized play/LFR/Twilight Ambitions|18}}
document_data.Organization: The cult was not particularly large, but held some influence over disillusioned [[fey]] and [[elves]] that dwelled within the [[Yuirwood]] and beyond.{{Cite organized play/LFR/First Strike|4}}
document_data.Activities:
Much of the cult's plots involved the ''[[Tome of Twilight Boughs]]'', an enigmatic and millennium-old [[Yuir]] text.{{Cite organized play/LFR/Through Twilight Boughs|30}} The book contained magically encrypted text, including the specifications for the ancient ''[[Ritual of the Doomed]]''. It appeared that, when the ritual was performed within areas afflicted by the [[Spellplague]], disastrous effects would ensue.

In fact, Vol Saffras was dedicated to fully understanding―and eventually controlling―the patches of [[plaguelands]] that appeared throughout Aglarond. She spent decades infiltrating and forming bonds with the outcast fey in the realm and learned secrets of the ancient Yuir. Vol Saffras conducted horrific experiments on the "loyal cultists" who had been exposed by effects of the Spellplague.
